summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message about navigating fear during the Christmas season! Pastor Travis Hearn delivered a powerful sermon about minimizing fear and embracing faith, especially during what can be a stressful time of year. Drawing from the Christmas story of Joseph and Mary, PT unpacks three key strategies for overcoming fear: walking in the light, surrendering control to God, and focusing on faith instead of fear. Can you imagine being Joseph, suddenly told your fiancée is pregnant - and not by you, but by the Holy Spirit? Talk about a moment that could paralyze someone with fear! Pastor Travis reminds us that God doesn't want us living in a spirit of fear, but in power, love, and a sound mind. He offers six incredible promises from Scripture to combat fear, including Isaiah 41:10 - 'Fear not, for I am with you.' The sermon is a timely reminder that during the chaos of Christmas, we can choose faith over fear, light over darkness, and trust over control. PT brilliantly illustrates how our focus determines our reality - whether we're hitting a golf ball or facing life's challenges. The message isn't just about surviving the holiday season, it's about thriving in God's peace and presence.
mainPoints: Walk in the light and stop hiding
Focus on faith instead of fear

versesMentioned.text: This is how the birth of Jesus the Messiah came about: His mother Mary was pledged to be married to Joseph, but before they came together, she was found to be pregnant through the Holy Spirit. Because Joseph her husband was faithful to the law, and yet did not want to expose her to public disgrace, he had in mind to divorce her quietly. But after he had considered this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, 'Joseph son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary home as your wife, because what is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit. She will give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins.'
When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, 'I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.'
Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.
For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind.
So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.
The Lord himself goes before you and will be with you; he will never leave you nor forsake you. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged.

Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.
Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.
Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.
'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'

Monday.scripture: Isaiah 41:10: 'So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.'
Monday.focus: Identifying areas of hidden fear in your life
Monday.action: Make a list of three situations or areas where fear currently controls your thoughts or actions. Pray over each one, asking God to help you surrender control and replace fear with faith.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal the hidden fears in my heart. Give me the courage to step into the light and trust You completely. Help me replace fear with faith and Your perfect peace. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 2 Timothy 1:7: 'For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding the difference between fear and faith
Tuesday.action: Journal about a recent situation where fear influenced your decision. Rewrite the scenario, imagining how you would respond with faith instead of fear.
Tuesday.prayer: God, transform my thinking. Help me recognize when fear is driving my decisions and give me the strength to choose faith. Fill me with Your power, love, and sound mind. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Wednesday.action: Identify one area of your life where you're trying to maintain total control. Deliberately create a plan to surrender that area to God, writing down specific steps of letting go.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my need for control. Help me trust You completely, even when I can't see the whole picture. Guide my steps and help me rest in Your plan. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Philippians 4:6-7: 'Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God.'
Thursday.action: Every time you feel anxiety rising today, immediately stop and pray. Thank God for His goodness and ask Him to replace your fear with peace.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, catch my anxious thoughts before they take root. Help me turn my worries into worship. Fill me with Your peace that surpasses understanding. Amen.

Friday.scripture: John 8:12: 'When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, 'I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.''
Friday.focus: Walking in spiritual light and transparency
Friday.action: Identify one area of your life where you're hiding or living in 'spiritual darkness'. Take a step towards honesty and transparency, either with God or a trusted friend.
Friday.prayer: God, shine Your light into the hidden corners of my heart. Give me the courage to live transparently and walk in Your light. Reveal and heal anything that keeps me in darkness. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: ''For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.''
Saturday.action: Create a 'promise journal'. Write down God's promises from Scripture and reflect on how they counteract the fears you've been experiencing.
Saturday.prayer: Faithful God, I choose to believe Your promises over my fears. Renew my mind and help me see my circumstances through the lens of Your unfailing love and perfect plans. Amen.
